client

Class Protocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.Protocol

  • public abstract class Protocol
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class containing static methods used for communication with the server It uses a method of communication explained in the ServerThread class Uses the BufferedReader and PrintWriter classes for IO with the server
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcin Gorczyñski
    See Also:
    BufferedReader, PrintWriter

      Protocol()

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static boolean login(java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String password,
            java.io.BufferedReader in,
            java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Attempts to login the user, returns if it succeded
        Parameters:
        username - the username to login
        password - the password of the user logging in
        in - reference to the input of the socket
        out - reference to the output of the socket
        Returns:
        true if logged in succefully, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        BufferedReader, PrintWriter

        Parameters:

        password - the password of the user logging in
        in - reference to the input of the socket
        out - reference to the output of the socket
        Returns:
        true if the user was created, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        BufferedReader, PrintWriter

             java.io.BufferedReader in,
             java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Checks if the user is online returning the result
        Parameters:

      • getMessages

        public static java.util.List<Message> getMessages(java.io.BufferedReader in,
                                  java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Gets all messages from the server return a reference to the list containing Message objects
        Parameters:
        in - reference to the input of the socket
        out - reference to the output of the socket
        Returns:
        true if the user exists, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
